revised_title: Observations on Subterranean Trees in Dagenham Marshes
tldr: The author investigates subterranean trees found in Dagenham Marshes and surrounding areas, examining their growth, composition, and possible origins. He suggests that these trees were likely buried by an extraordinary inundation of the River Thames, rather than by Noah's flood. The author also describes the soil and sediment in which the trees were found, and plans to conduct further experiments to better understand the phenomenon.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Soil and Sediment Analysis
